units.title: Introduce iTracer construct into iPSCs
units.text: This iTracer construct is introduced by electroporation into iPSCs that contain a doxycycline-inducible Cas9 cassette (iCRISPR)29,30.
units.rationale: This is an actionable step describing the method of introducing the lineage recorder construct into cells.

units.title: Initiate cerebral organoids from barcoded iPSCs
units.text: From these uniquely barcoded iPSCs, we initiate cerebral organoids using approximately 2,000 cells to record lineages during organoid development (Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: This describes a specific procedural step to start organoid culture from engineered cells for lineage tracing.

units.title: Induce Cas9 expression with doxycycline
units.text: At a time point of choice, doxycycline introduction into the medium induces Cas9 expression in organoid cells, followed by formation of Cas9–gRNA complexes, leading to double-stranded break formation at the targeted location in the fluorescent reporter region of the recorder.
units.rationale: This is a precise, time-controlled experimental procedure to trigger genomic scarring for lineage recording.

units.title: Optimize doxycycline concentration and duration for scarring
units.text: We found scarring was most efficient when samples were incubated with 8 µg ml−1 doxycycline for 24 h and applied these conditions in all subsequent experiments.
units.rationale: This provides a standardized protocol condition for inducing efficient Cas9-mediated scarring.

units.title: Isolate fluorescent reporter-expressing cells via flow cytometry
units.text: Fluorescent cells containing the reporter can be isolated using flow cytometry before being propagated or cryopreserved for later use.
units.rationale: This is a clear, actionable step for selecting and preserving engineered cells prior to organoid formation.

units.title: Perform targeted amplicon sequencing of barcode region
units.text: We followed barcode diversity throughout organoid development using targeted amplicon sequencing of the barcode region (Extended Data Fig. 1b,c)
units.rationale: This describes a specific molecular protocol to track barcode diversity over time.

units.title: Analyze barcode sharing between cell clusters
units.text: We performed a permutation enrichment analysis using single cells from all lineage-traced organoids together to determine the likelihood that barcode families were shared between cell clusters (Fig. 1g and Extended Data Fig. 4a,b).
units.rationale: This is a defined analytical procedure to assess clonal enrichment in transcriptional clusters.

units.title: Use 4D light-sheet microscopy to capture morphological dynamics
units.text: We also leverage 4D light-sheet microscopy to provide an assessment of clonal and morphological dynamics as the neuroepithelium develops at the onset of brain regionalization.
units.rationale: This describes a specific imaging protocol to track developmental dynamics in real time.

units.title: Incorporate CRISPR-based gene perturbation into iTracer
units.text: We incorporate CRISPR-based gene perturbation into the lineage-recorder system (iTracer-perturb) to enable temporal control of gene loss of function during organoid development, providing both transcriptomic and cell lineage readouts.
units.rationale: This outlines a procedural integration of gene perturbation with lineage tracing for functional analysis.
